description.b: Profiling tool is used: (1) In order to acquire the footprints of an unknown application or one of its components, on a specific physical host. The footprints consist of average execution metrics concerning CPU, RAM, disk and network utilization, and (2) in order to acquire the same type of footprints of a set of test-applications called benchmarks on the same physical host. The results of both execution modes of the tool, will be served as an input to a classification tool, which will decide upon the type of the application. Application types are defined according to the categorization of the benchmarks.

Follow very carefully the installation instructions concerning configurations on the physical machine, the benchmark virtual machine which will host the benchmark applications, as well as the application virtual machine which will host your own application or application component.

subitem.label: Make sure that the application is running on the virtual machine which is hosted on the same physical host as the Profiling Tool. Before running the executable jar file, a set of information should be available to be inserted as input for the tool: the Process ID of the virtual machine, passwords for the superuser of the Operating System running on the physical machine, the IP of the virtual machine.
After having inserted the information, start and stop buttons will control the profiling process. The application, as well as its workload generation must be running.
After the profiling process, the results can be found in the directory indicated to be the target directory.

Make sure that the benchmark virtual machine is configured and running properly. Before running the executable jar file, a set of information should be available to be inserted as input for the tool: the Process ID of the virtual machines, passwords for the superuser of the Operating System running on the physical and virtual machines, the IPs of the virual machines, the txt file containing the commands for the execution of the benchmarks.
After having inserted the information, the tool will execute the profiling process. The results will be stored in the directory that you indicated to be the target directory.

The results for both the application and benchmarks profiling must be stored and served as input for the classification tool. The benchmarks profiling results will act as the training data set while the application's profiling results will act as the working data set.
